content: ETFS REITs AMA The Fifth Person Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 18 Feb 2019Should I invest in REITs or REIT ETF?4 answersAnswerBump1
Answers (4)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent
Jonathan Chia Guangrong, Fund Manager at JCG FundLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 19 Feb 2019Individual reits for sure. Better yield and no management fees to be paid. 0 comments1

Sandra TeoLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 18 Feb 2019REITs ETF is extremely attractive to passive investors and beginners as it provides the opportunity to better diversify investments sectorally and geographically and allows minimal monitoring of the performance of REITs. But as Nicholes mentioned, for those investors who prefer to have more control, it would be more worthwhile to do their research and select a few REIT. One point to note is that although REITs ETF allow minimal monitoring, investing in REIT ETF without first understanding the index that the REIT ETF tracks, undermines the benefits of minimal monitoring. Specific to Singapore market, the REIT ETF market is relatively new and thus the performances of the REIT ETFs have short historical performance data. More data is required to provide insights on long-term performances of REIT ETFs. 0 comments1
Victor Chng, Co-Founder at Fifth Person Pte LtdLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 21 Feb 2019Hi,You should invest in REITs.0 comments0

Nicholes Wong, Diploma in Business Management at Nanyang PolytechnicLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 18 Feb 2019REITs. You alr pay fees to the REITS itself why pay more fees for people to manage ETF? Just do your research on the good REITs and buy them individually.0 comments0
